Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • sprites.Sprite
            • sprites.MovingSprite
              • sprites.Bullet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Destructive, Drawable, java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Bullet
extends MovingSprite
implements Destructive
    Something that a gun generates. Deals damage to damageables.
    Author:
    bleistiko405
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()

      • detectHit

        public boolean detectHit()
        can only detect hits if alive because the method is called in draw(PApplet marker)
        Parameters:
        worldlyThings - damageables in the world with which to check the collisions
        Returns:
        true if the bullet has hit something false otherwise
        Postcondition:
        if the bullet does hit something, the proper amount of damage is done to the damageable if the thing hit is damageable

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker)
        only draws bullets/detects collisions with bullets and other objects if the bullet is alive
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Drawable

      • dealDamage

        public void dealDamage(Damageable d)
        Description copied from interface: Destructive
        Deals damage to a Damageable object. Do NOT call d.takeDamage(this); it will generate an endless loop
        Specified by:
        dealDamage in interface Destructive
        Parameters:
        d - - the Damageable object to deal damage to
